verses.roman:
tāṅra lāgi' gopīnātha kṣīra curi kaila
mahāprabhura mukhe āge e kathā śunila

synonyms: tāṅra lāgi'-for him (Mādhavendra Purī); gopīnātha—the Deity named Gopīnātha; kṣīra—condensed milk; curi—stealing; kaila—performed; mahāprabhura mukhe—from the mouth of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; āge—previously; e kathā—this incident; śunila—heard.
translation: It was Gopīnātha who stole condensed milk for the sake of Mādhavendra Purī. This incident had been previously related by Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu Himself.
